title: Calories in Stewed Beef (Per 100g)
meta_description: Discover calories in stewed beef per 100g, including protein, fat, carbs, and full nutrition breakdown with tweaks and FAQs for better meal planning.
assumptions: Lean beef (e.g., chuck), trimmed of excess fat, stewed in water or broth without added oil, salt, or vegetables; cooked until tender.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by cut, fat content, cooking liquid, added ingredients, and portion size. Check labels or recipes for accuracy.

quick_answer.text: 100g of stewed beef provides ~250 kcal and ~26g protein.

label_note: Values align with Nutrition Facts panel for straightforward comparison.

tweaks.label: Add 1 tsp oil during stewing per 100g
Use leaner cut (e.g., round) vs. chuck per 100g
Include onions and carrots (50g veggies) per 100g beef

faqs.q: How many calories in 100g stewed beef?
faqs.a: Approximately 250 kcal for lean stewed beef.

faqs.q: What's the protein in stewed beef?
faqs.a: About 26g protein per 100g, making it a great lean meat option.
Typically 0g carbs if no vegetables or thickeners are added.

faqs.q: How does fat content affect calories in stewed beef?
faqs.a: Higher fat cuts increase calories; trimming fat reduces them by 20-50 kcal per 100g.

faqs.q: Is stewed beef lower in calories than fried beef?
faqs.a: Yes, stewing uses less added fat, often 50-100 kcal less per 100g than frying.
